symbols.name: sap.ndc
symbols.description: SAPUI5 library with controls with native device capabilities.

symbols.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner

methods.name: closeScanDialog
methods.description: Closes the barcode input dialog. It can be used to close the dialog before the user presses the OK or the Cancel button (e.g. in the fnLiveUpdate callback function of the {@link sap.ndc.BarcodeScanner.scan} method.)

methods.name: disableBluetoothBarcodeScanner
methods.description: Disable the Bluetooth Barcode Scanner.

methods.name: enableBluetoothBarcodeScanner

returnValue.description: Return True if the callback function or the settings is set successfully.

parameters.name: bluetoothCallBack
parameters.description: Function to be called by the Bluetooth Barcode Scanner. The status of Bluetooth Barcode Scanner is enable only when the callback function is set successfully.

parameters.name: oSettings
parameters.description:
An optional settings object to be used for the Bluetooth Barcode Scanner. Example: 

{
    "handleFocusedElement": true, // The default value is false. If true, the scanning output will only be returned by the callback function and won't be entered into the input field or text area that is the focused element.
    "triggerOneTime": true, // The default value is false. If set to true, the Bluetooth Barcode Scanner is used only once for the next scanning.
    "scanningMode": "TimeInterval", // Either "TimeInterval" or "PrefixSuffix" scanning modes are available. The default value is "TimeInterval". If "TimeInterval" is selected, the scanner will search for barcodes where the maximum time interval between any two characters cannot be greater than the value of "intervalForDetection". If "PrefixSuffix" is selected, the scanner will search for barcodes that start with the prefix and end with the suffix based on the values of "prefix" and "suffix."
    "intervalForDetection": 80, // The default value is 80 milliseconds. In "TimeInterval" scanning mode, it represents the maximum time interval between two characters in the scanning data.
    "prefix": "$", // The default value is "$". In "PrefixSuffix" scanning mode, the parameter is utilized to find a match with the prefix of the received barcode data.
    "suffix": "#", // The default value is "#". In "PrefixSuffix" scanning mode, the parameter is utilized to find a match with the suffix of the received barcode data.
    "replaceGS1Separator": true, // The default value is false. Enabling this option in our function allows for the detection and replacement of special characters within GS1 barcodes using the value specified in the GS1ReplacementCharacter parameter. To support GS1 barcode, the scanner needs to be configured to support special character using model given by GS1FunctionKey parameter.
    "GS1FunctionKey": "altKey" // Either "altKey" or "ctrlKey" GS1 Function Key are available. The default value is "altKey". If "altKey" is selected, when the scanner is configured to support "ALt 3 Digit HEX" and the "[GS]" is present in the scanning data, the value "ALT + 029" will be obtained and then converted to the string "/x1D". If "ctrlKey" is selected, when the scanner is configured to support "Windows Mode Control + X" and the "[GS]" is present in the scanning data, the value "Ctrl + ]" will be obtained and then converted to the string "/x1D".
    "GS1ReplacementCharacter": undefined // The default value is undefined. By default, the [GS] will be replaced with the symbol string "/x1D". If the GS1ReplacementCharacter parameter value is available, the "[GS]" will be replaced by the value.
}

methods.description:
Set the callback function and settings to the Bluetooth Barcode Scanner.

IMPORTANT: If the BarcodeScanner button is included into one iframe, the focus point must be into the window of the iframe. If not, the Bluetooth Barcode Scanner cannot be triggered.

methods.name: getScanAPIInfo

returnValue.description: The Barcode Scanner API info. (e.g. ZebraEnterpriseBrowser, Cordova, ZXingCPP or unknown)

methods.description: Returns the scanner API info that will be used to scan the barcode.

methods.name: getStatusModel

returnValue.description: The Barcode Scanner Status Model

methods.name: scan

parameters.name: fnSuccess
parameters.description: Function to be called when the scanning is done or cancelled

parameters.name: fnFail
parameters.description: Function to be called when the scanning is failed

parameters.name: fnLiveUpdate
parameters.description: Function to be called when value of the dialog's input is changed

parameters.name: dialogTitle
parameters.description: Defines the barcode input dialog title. If unset, a predefined title will be used.

parameters.name: preferFrontCamera
parameters.description: Flag, which defines whether the front or back camera should be used.

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.description: Defines the frame rate of the camera.

parameters.name: zoom
parameters.description: Defines the zoom of the camera. This parameter is not supported on iOS.

parameters.name: keepCameraScan
parameters.description: Flag, which defines whether the camera should be used for scanning in Zebra Enterprise Browser.

parameters.name: disableBarcodeInputDialog
parameters.description: Flag, which defines whether the Barcode input dialog should be shown.

methods.name: setConfig

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
The options are the configs that will be used to scan. Example: 

{
    "enableGS1Header": true,  //If set to true, add the symbology identifier (GS1 specification 5.4.3.7. and 5.4.6.4.) as prefix into the result text.
    "deviceId": "string" // The specific camera id to scan the Barcode. If set to "", Barcode Scanner will use default camera. This option is not working for iOS devices since do not support to get all the cameras.
    "multiScan": {
        "enabled": false, // If set to true, will support scan multi barcodes, and the max number of the barcodes in each scanning is 10. Default value is false. Only working for ZXingCPP.
        "showPauseButton": false, // If set to true, will show a button so that can pause/restart the scan in the scan dialog.
        "pauseIfHasResult": false, // If set to true, will pause current scan dialog if has result. Only working if showPauseButton === false.
        "stopIfOnlyHasOneResult": false // If set to true, will stop current scan and return the result when only has one result. Only working if showPauseButton === false and pauseIfHasResult === true.
    }
}

methods.description: Set the configs of the control Barcode Scanner.

methods.name: setPhysicalScan

parameters.name: fnPhysicalScan
parameters.description: Function to be called when the scanning is done by pressing physical scan button.

methods.description: Set the callback function for the physical scan button.

methods.name: setScanAPIInfo

returnValue.description: Return True if set success.

parameters.name: scannerAPI
parameters.description: Defines the scanner API to scan the barcode. Scanner API can be "ZebraEnterpriseBrowser", "Cordova" or "ZXingCPP".

methods.description: Set the scanner API info that will be used to scan the barcode. IMPORTANT: The status of the scanner API must be "Available"(for ZXingCPP, status is NOT "UnAvailable"), or will return False. Scanner APIs with status value can be got by using {@link #getStatusModel}. By default, Barcode Scanner will select the scanner API(Available) with priority: ZebraEnterpriseBrowser > Cordova > ZXingCPP.

symbols.name: sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton
symbols.description: A button control (displaying a barcode icon) to start the barcode scanning process. If the native scanning feature is not available or camera capability is not granted, the button is either hidden or it provides a fallback by opening a dialog with an input field where the barcode can be entered manually.

properties.name: provideFallback
properties.description: If set to true, the button remains visible if the scanner is not available and triggers a dialog to enter barcode.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the scanner button.

properties.name: dialogTitle
properties.description: Defines the barcode input dialog title. If unset, a predefined title will be used.

properties.name: preferFrontCamera
properties.description: If set to true, the front camera will be used to decode.

properties.name: frameRate
properties.description: Defines the frame rate of the camera.

properties.name: zoom
properties.description: Defines the zoom of the camera. This parameter is not supported on iOS.

properties.name: keepCameraScan
properties.description: If set to true, the camera should be used for scanning in Zebra Enterprise Browser.

properties.name: disableBarcodeInputDialog
properties.description: If the value is true, the Barcode input dialog should be hidden.

aggregations.name: _btn
aggregations.description: Internal aggregation to hold the inner Button.

events.name: scanSuccess
events.description: Event is fired when the scanning is finished or cancelled

text.name: text
text.description: The the text representation of the barcode data.

format.name: format
format.description: The type of the barcode detected.

cancelled.name: cancelled
cancelled.description: Indicates whether or not the user cancelled the scan.

events.name: scanFail
events.description: Event is fired when the native scanning process is failed.

events.name: inputLiveUpdate
events.description: Event is fired when the text in the dialog's input field is changed.

newValue.name: newValue
newValue.description: The new value of the input field.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new BarcodeScannerButton. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

newValue.name: newValue

methods.name: attachInputLiveUpdate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton itself

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:inputLiveUpdate inputLiveUpdate} event of this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton itself. Event is fired when the text in the dialog's input field is changed.

parameters.name: fnFunction

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton itself

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:scanFail scanFail} event of this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton itself. Event is fired when the native scanning process is failed.

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:scanSuccess scanSuccess} event of this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton itself. Event is fired when the scanning is finished or cancelled

methods.name: detachInputLiveUpdate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

methods.description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:inputLiveUpdate inputLiveUpdate} event of this sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Control.extend}.

methods.name: getDialogTitle

returnValue.description: Value of property dialogTitle

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDialogTitle dialogTitle}.

Defines the barcode input dialog title. If unset, a predefined title will be used.

methods.name: getDisableBarcodeInputDialog

returnValue.description: Value of property disableBarcodeInputDialog

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDisableBarcodeInputDialog disableBarcodeInputDialog}. If the value is true, the Barcode input dialog should be hidden. Default value is false.

methods.name: getFrameRate

returnValue.description: Value of property frameRate

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFrameRate frameRate}.

Defines the frame rate of the camera.

methods.name: getKeepCameraScan

returnValue.description: Value of property keepCameraScan

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getKeepCameraScan keepCameraScan}. If set to true, the camera should be used for scanning in Zebra Enterprise Browser. Default value is false.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ndc.BarcodeScannerButton.

methods.name: getPreferFrontCamera

returnValue.description: Value of property preferFrontCamera

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getPreferFrontCamera preferFrontCamera}. If set to true, the front camera will be used to decode. Default value is false.

methods.name: getProvideFallback

returnValue.description: Value of property provideFallback

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getProvideFallback provideFallback}. If set to true, the button remains visible if the scanner is not available and triggers a dialog to enter barcode. Default value is true.

methods.name: getWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property width

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}.

Defines the width of the scanner button.

methods.name: getZoom

returnValue.description: Value of property zoom

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getZoom zoom}.

Defines the zoom of the camera. This parameter is not supported on iOS.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sDialogTitle
parameters.description: New value for property dialogTitle

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDialogTitle dialogTitle}. Defines the barcode input dialog title. If unset, a predefined title will be used. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.
